com.defano.jmonet.tools

Class LassoTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.builder.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractSelectionTool
        • com.defano.jmonet.tools.LassoTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, MutableSelection, Selection, TransformableCanvasSelection, TransformableImageSelection, TransformableSelection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener

    public class LassoTool
extends AbstractSelectionTool
implements TransformableSelection, TransformableCanvasSelection
    Selection tool allowing the user to draw a free-form selection path on the canvas.

        public LassoTool()

    • Method Detail

      • resetSelection

        public void resetSelection()
        Transitions to an un-selected state. Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. Selection.getSelectionOutline() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection.
        Specified by:
        resetSelection in interface MutableSelection

      • setSelectionOutline

        public void setSelectionOutline(Rectangle bounds)
        Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionOutline in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

      • addSelectionPoint

        protected void addSelectionPoint(Point initialPoint,
                                 Point newPoint,
                                 boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Specified by:
        addSelectionPoint in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • completeSelection

        protected void completeSelection(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path.
        Specified by:
        completeSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • getSelectionOutline

        public Shape getSelectionOutline()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn. Note that the location of the shape's bounds is translated to the selection's location on the canvas. Use Selection.getIdentitySelectionOutline() for a selection outline located at (0, 0) and suitable for testing whether a pixel in the selected image is within the selection shape's mask.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionOutline in interface Selection
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape and location on the canvas

      • translateSelection

        public void translateSelection(int xDelta,
                               int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection should be moved on the canvas and therefore the selection shape's coordinates should be translated accordingly.
        Specified by:
        translateSelection in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds vertically.
